body: Daniel, I believe that I understand what you are tying to do but you should be clearer about your terminology as I think this is the first time many of us are using the term 'thermal history' to refer to use of the previous hour's E+ results instead of a warm-up period.  Let me know if I am wrong with understanding this: A: Just a normal annual simulation. B: 8760 different simulations, each of which is only one hour long. If this is true, you can easily run through all hour-long analysis periods (option B) with the following: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/aNZ9EZ3f4*yTvF7sovq-IL72sGruHSUQ4-uMvOzt1o5ZNVU9hMoF0VipmSyUvAy5r6iRqVadB8ED9aF4KkB6O9cwAPyLuh2f/AnalysisPeriodforEachHr.PNG) Just animate the slider.  I attached a GH file with the components above. -Chris
